actions.committee: House Committee on Public Works and Transportation
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Public Works and Transportation.

official_title: A bill to direct the Secretary of Transportation to make a comprehensive study of a high-speed ground transportation system between Washington, District of Columbia, and Annapolis, Md., and a high-speed marine vessel transportation system between the Baltimore-Annapolis area in Maryland and the Yorktown-Williamsburg-Norfolk area in Virginia; and if the study findings are positive, to direct that the Department of Transportation proceed with construction within 1 year from resources allocated for such programs or seek enabling legislation for additional resources if such is required.
short_title: Advanced Technology Transportation System Demonstration Act

summary.text: Advanced Technology Transportation System Demonstration Act - Directs the Secretary of Transportation to make a comprehensive study of a high-speed ground transportation system between Washington, District of Columbia, and Annapolis, Maryland, and a high-speed marine vessel transportation system between the Baltimore- Annapolis area in Maryland and the Yorktown-Williamsburg-Norfolk area in Virginia. Authorizes appropriations of up to $300,000 to carry out the study. States that if the study findings are positive, the Department of Transportation shall proceed with construction within one year from resources allocated for such programs or seek enabling legislation for additional resources if such is required.

titles.title: Advanced Technology Transportation System Demonstration Act

A bill to direct the Secretary of Transportation to make a comprehensive study of a high-speed ground transportation system between Washington, District of Columbia, and Annapolis, Md., and a high-speed marine vessel transportation system between the Baltimore-Annapolis area in Maryland and the Yorktown-Williamsburg-Norfolk area in Virginia; and if the study findings are positive, to direct that the Department of Transportation proceed with construction within 1 year from resources allocated for such programs or seek enabling legislation for additional resources if such is required.
